meanings.definition: To reveal the true identity or nature of something or someone.
meanings.sent1: During the play, the detective will unmask the villain and reveal their true identity.
meanings.sent2: The superhero decided to unmask the criminal and show everyone who they really were.
meanings.sent3: At the masquerade party, the magician tried to unmask the mysterious guest, but it turned out to be a prank.
meanings.sent4: The investigation would unmask the corruption within the company, exposing the true nature of their operations.
meanings.sent5: The documentary aimed to unmask the myths surrounding the ancient artifact, revealing its true history.

meanings.definition: To remove a mask from someone's face.
meanings.sent1: The nurse gently unmasked the patient after the surgery to help them breathe more easily.
meanings.sent2: In the theater production, the actor had to unmask the lead actress as part of the dramatic scene.
meanings.sent3: During the costume party, the mischievous child tried to unmask their friend, but it only led to laughter.
meanings.sent4: The magician's trick involved unmasking the volunteer from the audience to reveal a surprising twist.
meanings.sent5: The makeup artist carefully unmasked the model after the photo shoot, revealing their natural beauty.

meanings.definition: To expose or uncover something hidden or secret.
meanings.sent1: The journalist worked tirelessly to unmask the corruption within the government and bring it to light.
meanings.sent2: The whistleblower decided to unmask the illegal activities of the company, risking their own safety.
meanings.sent3: The treasure hunters hoped to unmask the location of the hidden treasure using the ancient map.
meanings.sent4: The investigation aimed to unmask the truth behind the mysterious disappearances in the small town.
meanings.sent5: The documentary crew set out to unmask the conspiracy theories surrounding the famous celebrity's disappearance.
